CodeplexIssue.Title: Some lists are not Enumerable in Outlook
CodeplexIssue.DescriptionHtml: Please implement IEnumerable on the various lists across the solution. Otherwise, there are a lot of foreach-statements in applications that would need to be rewritten to for-loops for people migrating to NetOffice.   Examples from my compile output: foreach statement cannot operate on variables of type 'NetOffice.OutlookApi._Items' because 'NetOffice.OutlookApi._Items' does not contain a public definition for 'GetEnumerator' foreach statement cannot operate on variables of type 'NetOffice.OutlookApi.Stores' because 'NetOffice.OutlookApi.Stores' does not contain a public definition for 'GetEnumerator' foreach statement cannot operate on variables of type 'NetOffice.OutlookApi._Folders' because 'NetOffice.OutlookApi._Folders' does not contain a public definition for 'GetEnumerator'   As an example, see attached file, or https://gist.github.com/1284715#file__items_enumerator.cs , where I have implemented an Enumerator for _Items.cs in v1.1 of NetOffice.   If you want to, I could contribute by creating a patch for the three lists mentioned. But you probably have a better overview of how many places this should be implemented. And maybe if there is a generic solution so we don't need so much copy-pasting.

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
yes i know, these types doesnt have a real enumerator. microsoft add these faked enumerators also to the Primary Interop Assemblies(not the normaly Interop Assemblies)
i think i can create a rule for my codegenerator. types with an int count property and a default item property with the member id 0(this indexer in .net) and no enumerator
will have a faked enumerator in next netoffice release. what i want to do is collect all items in an array before i start the enumerator, the enumerator items count are not changeble while retrieving in this way.
thanks for this issue! its a good enhancement ;)

CodeplexComment.Author: Nilzor
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Ok thanks for the reply - looking forward to the next version :)

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
the codegenerator is now updated: the following classes has a custom enumerator in NetOffice Release 2.0
Word.Adjustments Word.Editors Word.OMathArgs Word.BuildingBlockTypes Word.Categories Word.BuildingBlocks Word.BuildingBlockEntries Word.OMathBreaks Outlook.AddressEntries Outlook._Folders Outlook._Items Outlook.Panes Outlook.Selection Outlook.AddressLists Outlook.SyncObjects Outlook._Explorers Outlook._Inspectors Outlook.Actions Outlook.PropertyPages Outlook.Attachments Outlook.UserProperties Outlook.Recipients Outlook.Links Outlook.Exceptions Outlook._OutlookBarShortcuts Outlook._OutlookBarGroups Outlook.Pages Outlook._Results Outlook.Conflicts Outlook._NavigationModules Outlook._Rules Outlook._RuleActions Outlook._RuleConditions Outlook._Columns Outlook._UserDefinedProperties Outlook._Accounts Outlook._Stores Outlook._Categories Outlook._TimeZones Outlook._AttachmentSelection Outlook._ViewFields Outlook._OrderFields Outlook._AutoFormatRules Outlook._NavigationGroups Outlook._NavigationFolders Outlook._SimpleItems Office.Adjustments Office.AnswerWizardFiles Office.ODSOColumns Office.ODSOFilters Office.ServerPolicy PowerPoint.Adjustments PowerPoint.PPRadioCluster OWC10.ChDataLabels OWC10.ChErrorBarsCollection OWC10.ChSegments OWC10.ChChartFields OWC10.Headings OWC10.FieldListDragDataList MSProject.Windows Excel.IPanes
the release 2.0 is planned with the next release of ms-office but i publish stable release previews from time to time related with completed roadmap items.
the first release preview comes 01/12/2011

CodeplexComment.Author: atschirren
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Please make CustomDocumentProperties and BuiltInDocumentProperties on Word.Document enumerable as well.

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: NetOffice 1.3 is available now and includes custom enumerators. issue closed. have a nice day!

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: my bad, not closed. i mean fixed.

CodeplexComment.Author: Nilzor
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Thanks, tested it now - porting from standard PIA's is now much easier :)
